intro: Lepidaploa subsquarrosa, commonly known as the squarrose lepidaploa, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodland areas. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators. Lepidaploa subsquarrosa is a relatively rare species, with limited distribution in specific regions of North America.
